wikipedia_page.main: Frank Pery Knox  (23 January 1880 – 1 February 1960) was an English first-class cricketer active 1899–1902 who played for Surrey He was born in Clapham, was educated at Dulwich College and Corpus Christi College, Oxford, and died in Hove. During World War I he was an officer in the Army Service Corps; along with many other officers he was awarded the DSO in the 1918 Birthday Honours "for services rendered in connection with Military Operations in France and Flanders."
